title: A Bad Name
author: Ziel
curatorNote: An atypical Gamer fic. Protagonist isn't Taylor—it's a homeless addict. After getting the System, the focus isn't grinding levels—it's getting clean, self-redemption, finding reasons to live. Unexpectedly moving. Ongoing.

title: A Cloudy Path
author: LacksCreativity
curatorNote: Supreme Commander x Worm. Taylor gets sci-fi RTS manufacturing abilities. The embodiment of escalation fic, farming to the sky. Abandoned, but the journey is the destination.

title: A Practical Guide to Evil
author: ErraticErrata
curatorNote: A villain's practical guide. Catherine Foundling joins the legions of evil, because sometimes the only way to save your country is to conquer it. 2 million word epic about fate, narrative tropes, and punching the rules. Recently published on Amazon.

title: A Wand for Skitter
author: ShayneT
curatorNote: Bug girl hits Hogwarts, and magical Britain trembles. Post-GM Taylor wakes up in the Harry Potter world, powers intact. Solving HP problems with Worm logic—decisive, fast-paced. ShayneT's signature work. Pure satisfaction.

title: Acceleration
author: chibipoe
curatorNote: Taylor gets Accelerator's power. Strongest in physics. Invincible power fantasy, watching her crush everything. Completed, though the ending's a bit rushed.

title: Amelia
author: TanaNari
curatorNote: When two biokinetics team up, power creep never stops. Taylor and Amy's partnership goes from cooperation to codependence, derailing the timeline completely. Completed, content-rich, but be warned—the escalation has no brakes.

title: Atonement
author: Cerulean
curatorNote: What if Taylor died in the locker? In this timeline, Taylor had a heart attack, didn't survive. Madison is crushed by guilt, triggers powers. She puts on a costume not to be a hero, but to fill the hole she dug herself. Called 'the best Spider-Man story, just set in Worm.'

title: Azarinth Healer
author: Rhaegar
synopsis: A new world with near limitless possibilities. A healing class capable of dealing damage. A character who enjoys the simple pleasures of punching monsters in the face.

title: Beware of Chicken
author: Casualfarmer
synopsis: Bi De was a simple cultivator, until he died and was reborn as a simple chicken in a cultivation world. Instead of seeking power and dominance, he decides to farm and raise chickens. A cozy masterpiece that subverts xianxia tropes with wholesome rural life.

title: Blood of the Frontier
author: Magoose
curatorNote: Crusader Kings politics in novel form. Medieval dynasty struggles, frontier survival, imperial ruthlessness. If you like grand strategy games' scheming and gray morality, this hits the spot.

title: Burn Up
author: JinglyJangles
curatorNote: 40k words. The peak of Worm fanfic prose. Taylor gets volatile heat powers, and her personality ignites with them. No complex plots—just pure emotional combustion. Reads like a bullet heating up—stream-of-consciousness, manic, beautiful. Short, complete, highly recommended.

title: Camera Shy
author: TheGreatGimmick
curatorNote: Taylor can turn invisible—but only when no one's looking. Sounds weak, right? But smart powers plus smart application equals endless possibilities. Creative premise, solid execution. Ongoing, worth following.

title: Cenotaph
author: notes
curatorNote: The lone vigilante trilogy begins. After her father dies, Taylor says no to the hero system. No Wards, no trusting anyone, waging war alone in Brockton Bay's shadows. Colder, harder, more hopeless than canon. A landmark in Worm fanfic.

title: Constellations
author: UnwelcomeStorm
curatorNote: The healing fic. Got wrecked by Worm? Come here to recover. Taylor meets a dog. Might be a Shinto goddess, might just be a very good dog. They open a tea shop. No gore, no despair, just warmth. Abandoned but doesn't matter—what exists is spiritually complete.

title: Contact at Kobol
author: wilkins75
curatorNote: The Colonial Fleet finds Earth—but it's Stargate's Earth. Two sci-fi universes collide. Earth with Asgard tech is overwhelming firepower against the Colonials. Military sci-fi crossover that satisfies both fandoms.

title: Copacetic
author: Materia-Blade
curatorNote: After Golden Morning, Taylor wants a normal life. She lost her powers, changed her identity, trying to start over. But the world remembers what she did, and so does she. A meditation on 'what happens after the hero retires.' Abandoned, but what exists is beautiful.

title: CORDYCEPS: Too clever for their own good
author: Benedict_SC
curatorNote: Psychological horror. Short, sharp, dirty. You wake up in a facility with no memory. Something's wrong. Don't look anything up—just read. Every twist is earned. Best experienced blind.

title: Dear Spellbook
author: Peter J. Lee
synopsis: A D&D sorcerer finds himself trapped in a time loop, forced to rely on his magical journal to preserve his memories across iterations. A LitRPG mystery that combines D&D mechanics with compelling character development and puzzle-solving.

title: Defiance of the Fall
author: TheFirstDefier
synopsis: The System arrived, and with it, a world changed. Animals mutated, dungeons appeared, and humanity was forced to adapt or die. Zac found himself in the middle of a dangerous forest, armed with nothing but a rusty knife and a desperate will to survive. Pure number-crunching satisfaction as cultivation meets System in an epic mashup.

title: Deputy
author: Reyemile
curatorNote: Taylor joins the PRT as civilian staff. Not a Ward—a deputy. Working within the system, solving problems through proper channels, showing heroes 'how it's done.' Bureaucracy fic, surprisingly compelling.

title: Dire Born
author: Andrew Seiple
synopsis: Born with powers that make her a monster in the eyes of the world, one woman chooses to become a villain. But not just any villain — she channels Doctor Doom's philosophy and presence. A female villain protagonist who conquers Amazon after rising from SpaceBattles forums.

title: Dire Worm
author: Lost Demiurge
curatorNote: Doctor Dire has arrived! Supervillain, genius, drama queen—all in one. A high-IQ villain from another universe crashes into Brockton Bay, stirring everything with maximum theatrics. Character so compelling the author wrote original novels about her. Abandoned but spectacular.

title: Dungeon Crawler Carl
author: Matt Dinniman
synopsis: When Earth is turned into a dungeon by aliens, Carl and his ex-girlfriend's cat, Princess Donut, must survive. The #1 fan favorite of Royal Road — funnier, crazier, more heartbreaking. A man and his cat navigate a deadly dungeon livestream where anything goes.

title: Dungeon Keeper Ami
author: Pusakuronu
curatorNote: Sailor Mercury's Ami, forced to run an evil dungeon. She wants to be good, but her job description says demon lord. Moral dilemmas, rational decisions, holding the line in a dark system. Mega-length, still ongoing.

title: El-Ahrairah
author: Anderein
curatorNote: The Prince with a Thousand Enemies. Taylor gets a Thinker power inspired by Watership Down's rabbit god. Wins through wisdom and strategy, not combat. Slower paced but deep. Don't miss if you like mindgame stories.

title: Forge of Destiny
author: Yrsillar
curatorNote: Cultivation done right. Ling Qi, a street urchin, enters a cultivation sect. No face-slapping, no broken engagements—just politics, friendship, and very good music. Quest-to-novel transition that balances progression with character growth. Published on Amazon.

title: Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality
author: Eliezer Yudkowsky
curatorNote: What if Harry was a scientist? Petunia married a professor, Harry grew up on the scientific method, now he wants to figure out magic's underlying logic. The foundational rationalist fic—smart, arrogant, utterly unique. Loved or hated, never forgotten.

title: Heromaker's Legacy
author: TheGrum
curatorNote: Infrastructure fic taken to extremes. Taylor triggers bug control, then discovers alien tech infrastructure. Manufacturing, testing, upgrading—numbers going up constantly. If you like watching power stats explode, this is for you.

title: Hunter
author: UnwelcomeStorm
curatorNote: Bloodborne x Worm. Taylor inherits the Hunter's Dream. Gothic horror, cosmic dread, oversized weapons. If you've played Bloodborne, you'll love this.

title: I Woke Up As a Dungeon, Now What?
author: Aku-dono
curatorNote: Taylor becomes a dungeon core. Farming, trap-building, monster management in an isekai. Creative premise, fun execution. Abandoned but charming.

title: Intrepid
author: Cerulean
curatorNote: Four girls, four fate lines, destined to converge. After the locker, Taylor falls into a coma. Madison, Emma, Sophia each trigger, joining different factions. They don't know about each other, but readers know they'll reunite. Multi-POV ensemble drama, massive scope, abandoned but content-rich.

title: Kill Them All
author: ShayneT
curatorNote: ShayneT product, murder-leveling flow. Taylor gets Gamer powers, slaughtering everyone who hurt her across the multiverse. Violent, cathartic, unapologetic. Come here for power fantasy.

title: Legacy
author: notes
curatorNote: The trilogy ends. Closing out this dark parallel universe. If you've read this far, you don't need a pitch.

title: Manager
author: Seraviel
curatorNote: Power management master. Taylor can seize, merge, and redistribute superpowers. She turns heroism into resource management, playing Brockton Bay with multiple identities. Fun premise, abandoned but worth checking out.

title: Marked for Death
author: EagleJarl & Velorien
curatorNote: Children abandoned by their village. A squad of Mist genin sent on suicide missions as cannon fodder choose to run instead. Now they're missing-nin, hunted by Bloody Mist. Not shonen—this is child soldiers, political sacrifice, and survival simulation. SV's longest-running Quest, peak rationalist Naruto.

title: Memories of Iron
author: becuzitswrong
curatorNote: Taylor gets Tony Stark's memories and tech. Iron Man x Worm. Tech-stomp satisfaction, well-written. Sadly, the author passed away—it'll never be finished. As a legacy, worth reading and remembering.

title: Mixed Feelings
author: Kittius
curatorNote: The most nuanced trauma psychology in Worm fic. Astrid triggers under her racist father's abuse, forced into the Wards. This isn't about fights—it's about a girl raised on hate learning to shed those chains, trust again, redefine herself. Slow burn, 700k words of gradual healing, but the characters feel painfully real.

title: Mother of Learning
author: nobody103
synopsis: Zorian is a teenage mage of humble birth and modest skill, attending his third year of education at Cyoria's magical academy. A month before the end of year exams, he finds himself trapped in a time loop, repeating the same month over and over again.

title: Pact
author: Wildbow
curatorNote: You're drowning from chapter one. Wildbow gives you no room to breathe. Blake inherits a diabolist family's legacy, and then the entire world wants him dead. Not metaphorically—literally. You'll stare at the ceiling for a while after finishing. Don't read when you're already down, but if you want to feel hunted, this beats any horror movie.

title: Pale
author: Wildbow
curatorNote: Three high school girls investigating a supernatural murder. Sounds cute, right? It is. It's also terrifying. Wildbow finally learned to let readers breathe—there's warmth, friendship, belonging. But it's still Wildbow, so there's stuff that'll keep you up at night. 1.4 million words, completed. Best entry point into Wildbow.

title: Pale Lights
author: ErraticErrata
synopsis: In the city of Laure, power is everything. Noble houses vie for dominance, gangs rule the streets, and ancient horrors lurk beneath. A story of politics, ambition, and cosmic horror. If you loved Arcane's vibe, you'll love this — Lovecraft meets gang warfare meets noble academy.

title: Pokemon: The Origin of Species
author: DaystarEld
curatorNote: Pokemon world, taken seriously. Red, Blue, and Leaf's journey, but Pokemon are scientifically studied and trainers face real moral dilemmas. Rationalist, ongoing, substantial depth.

title: Purple Days
author: Baurus
curatorNote: Joffrey's time loop. Yes, that Joffrey. He dies at the Purple Wedding, wakes up to start over. Once, twice, hundreds of times. Pain grinds down edges and forges new souls. 2017 Turtledove winner, proving any character can be redeemed through enough suffering.

title: Queen of Blood
author: SirWill
curatorNote: Vampire queen descends on Brockton Bay. Worm x Castlevania crossover. Taylor inherits Dracula's power—gothic horror meets superheroes. Gorgeous aesthetic, satisfying fights.

title: RE: Monarch
author: J. McCoy
synopsis: Elijah feels like he's died and gone to heaven. In this new world, he has power, magic, and the ability to make a difference. But the world is dangerous, and his second chance at life might be shorter than he thinks. A gritty time loop story with high stakes and meaningful progression.

title: Ring-Maker
author: LithosMaitreya
curatorNote: Sauron's craft, Myrddin's redemption. Taylor can forge Rings of Power. This isn't consuming Tolkien—it's honoring him. The author truly understands Middle-earth and truly understands Worm. Two systems fused seamlessly. Completed, epic as hell.

title: Security!
author: Ack
curatorNote: An ordinary security guard transmigrates to Worm with plot knowledge. Sounds formulaic, right? But this one actually sells 'normal person in a superpowered world.' No cheats, no flexing—just a middle-aged guy trying to do the right thing. Completed, surprisingly heartfelt.

title: Seventh Horcrux
author: Emerald Ashes
curatorNote: The funniest Harry Potter fic ever written. Harry is actually Voldemort's seventh Horcrux—and the soul fragment took over. Now 'Harry' must pretend to be a normal student while being deeply confused by everyone around him. Non-stop gold, laugh-until-it-hurts funny.

title: Skein
author: TheGreatGimmick
curatorNote: Brain-twister. Taylor gets language and thought manipulation powers, navigating the cape scene through prediction and control. Not a punching story—an outwitting story. Complex, sophisticated prose. Readers who like thinking will be satisfied.

title: Sufficiently Advanced Magic
author: Andrew Rowe
synopsis: Corin Cadence always wanted to be a magic user. Unfortunately, in the world of Attis, magic is strictly controlled. But when he discovers a way to enter the prestigious magic academy of Mt. Thetis, he'll do whatever it takes to unlock the secrets of magic. Hard magic system with detailed crafting and progression.

title: Tabloid
author: babylonsheep
curatorNote: The most unique angle: paparazzi in a superhero world. Paul works PRT PR by day, uses his Stranger power to photograph capes for tabloids by night. A gray-zone survivor, balancing two lives. Completed, beautifully illustrated, criminally underrated.

title: The Games We Play
author: Ryuugi
curatorNote: The ceiling of RWBY Gamer fic. Jaune Arc gets the power to live life as an RPG, then levels up to fighting gods. Million words, completed. If you like watching numbers go up, this will satisfy.

title: The Last Angel
author: Proximal Flame
curatorNote: The ceiling of space opera. An AI warship, alone against the empire that exterminated humanity. Two thousand years. Red One hides in deep space, methodically taking revenge, until she discovers humans survived. Revenge or rebuild? This choice will tear you apart. Essential reading if you like Halo or Mass Effect.

title: The Last Angel: Ascension
author: Proximal Flame
curatorNote: The spark becomes wildfire. Red One's vengeance is no longer personal—she's igniting rebellion across the sector. Bigger scope, more factions, galactic politics emerging. Fans of the first won't be disappointed.

title: The Last Angel: The Hungry Stars
author: Proximal Flame
curatorNote: The war has just begun. Third in the series, ongoing. The threat now exceeds the Alliance itself. If you've read this far, you don't need anyone's recommendation.

title: The Menocht Loop
author: caerulex
synopsis: What happens when you've already mastered the time loop? When you've already learned everything, seen everything, done everything? A unique take on the time loop genre following an overpowered protagonist trying to find meaning in endless repetition.

title: The Perfect Run
author: Void Herald
synopsis: A dead man walks through a post-apocalyptic city, trying to survive while maintaining his deadpan humor. Each loop brings new challenges and reveals dark secrets about the world he's trying to save.
editorNote: Deadpool-style humor meets time-loop survival — fast, sharp, and finished.

title: The Primal Hunter
author: Zogarth
synopsis: Earth is integrated into the Universal System. Monsters are real, and skills exist. Jake, a loner who prefers hunting in the wilderness, finds himself thrust into this new reality. As a lone wolf archer, he must evolve, kill, and grow stronger. A system apocalypse with faster pacing and focus on survival.

title: The Wandering Inn
author: pirateaba
curatorNote: 12 million words. The longest web novel in English. Erin Solstice opens an inn in another world. That's the premise. But this inn becomes sanctuary, battlefield, home. Cozy, vast, about community and belonging. 18 volumes on Amazon. If you want to completely immerse in a world, this is your door.

title: The World As It Appears To Be
author: Benedict_SC
curatorNote: Rationalist Overwatch. Mercy's tech is more advanced than anyone realizes—she can backup and restore teammates' complete consciousness. When the secret gets out, everyone faces the question: if you copy someone's memories, are they still alive? Hardcore sci-fi ensemble.

title: Trailblazer
author: 3ndless
curatorNote: The ultimate fusion of mechs and superpowers. Taylor triggers with the ability to build Gundams. Real Gundams. 1.6 million words of epic, grafting Gundam's tech tree perfectly onto Worm's wasteland. Completed, with an ending worthy of the length. The ceiling of Worm crossover fic, bar none.

title: Tree of Aeons
author: spaizzzer
synopsis: Matt died. But he didn't stay dead. Instead, he woke up as a tree in a fantasy world. A tree with a System. Now he must grow, evolve, and build a forest kingdom while navigating the politics of gods and mortals alike.

title: Twig
author: Wildbow
curatorNote: Wildbow's most underrated work. 1920s biopunk—a group of lab-made Frankenstein children deployed as disposable spies. Dark as hell, but the bonds between these kids are the gentlest thing Wildbow's ever written. Sylvester will move into your heart, and then Wildbow will use him to hurt you. Keep tissues handy.

title: Wake
author: notes
curatorNote: Cenotaph's sequel. Taylor's no longer alone—which means she has weaknesses now. The war escalates, shadows deepen, costs mount. If you liked the first one's hardboiled style, this won't disappoint.

title: Ward
author: Wildbow
curatorNote: This isn't Worm 2—don't come expecting that. Victoria crawls out of the wreckage, trying to rebuild her life. A book about trauma—real trauma that takes time to heal. Slower paced than Worm, which loses some readers. But if you finished Worm wondering 'what next?' and want to see broken people keep living, Ward delivers.

title: Weaver Nine
author: Thinker6
curatorNote: What if Taylor was a serial killer? What if Jack Slash was a hero? Identities swapped, but humanity's core unchanged. That's what makes it truly chilling. Peak dark AU, brilliant mindgames. Abandoned but worth reading.

title: Worm
author: Wildbow
curatorNote: People who finish this fall into two camps: those who won't shut up about it, and those writing fanfic. Taylor goes from a bullied girl shoved into a locker to something that makes gods despair. 1.68 million words sounds scary, but once you hit the Leviathan fight, sleep becomes optional. Here, doing the right thing often costs everything—and this book will ruin other superhero stories for you.

title: Worm: More Than Meets the Eye
author: Metallix666
curatorNote: Taylor builds Transformers. Giant robots, faction drama, philosophical questions about personhood. Better crossover fusion than expected, abandoned but fun.

title: Worth the Candle
author: Alexander Wales
synopsis: Juniper Smith is a teenage dungeon master who finds himself transported into a world that is an amalgamation of every fictional world he ever created. Now he must survive and find meaning in a place built from his own imagination.
